channel.title: NPCs disappearing?
channel.description:
This is my problem: I'm making a quest, where an NPC is spawned and yeah, you talk to it, however... the NPC appears to everyone, and if multiple people do this quest, then the place is going to be crowded with the same NPCs wouldn't it? I need a way to make it that the NPC that is spawned is only visible to one person
Oh, and i'm using project 16V4.5 as a base

item.title: NPCs disappearing?
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

npcs[i].Respawns = false; npcs[i].HP = 0;
That would make it disapear after you spoke to it.

Or you could edit npcs array and add and extra int to do with the player so that only the one could talk to it?

Or, have the person doing the quest teleported somewhere with the npc and be teleported back after they are done speaking to it?

item.description:

Bad move to make them teleport to Null. That could increase the amount of lag on your server.

About the NPC, you could create a variable that controlled the proper SignEndian streamed Hex code to make an area visible to a single player, and call on it with conditional statements. That is your best offer (I do not know the SignEndian nor any preset variables that have to do with single visible areas.) Possibly look through the main cases and see if you can find any of those variables. Very useful, they will be, in the future constructon skill…
